question: Which is the second-most happiest country in the world, as of March 2020?
explanation: Denmark is the second-most happiest country in the world. Denmark ranked second in the World Happiness Report published by the UnitedÂ  Nations Sustainable Development Solutions Network. As of March 2020, Finland ranked the happiest country in the world. In Denmark, citizens experience a high sense of autonomy and freedom, as well as high levels of social trust towards each other, which plays an important role in determining life satisfaction.
